articles.description: Follow live radio commentary and text updates as England seek to start their World Cup with a morale-boosting win in Marseille.
articles.title: England face Argentina in tough World Cup opener - radio & text

articles.description: Home favourite Coco Gauff takes on incoming world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the US Open final - follow live.
articles.title: US Open women's final: Gauff v Sabalenka - build-up

articles.description: England's winning run in their Euro 2024 qualifying campaign comes to a halt as they are held to a draw by Ukraine in Wroclaw.
articles.title: England winning run halted by draw with Ukraine

articles.description: Ireland open their Rugby World Cup campaign with a bonus-point win as they score 12 tries to overwhelm Romania in Bordeaux.
articles.title: Ireland begin World Cup with 12-try win over Romania

articles.description: England bounce back from their shock T20 series defeat by hammering Sri Lanka in the first one-day international at Chester-le-Street.
articles.title: England hammer Sri Lanka in first ODI

articles.description: Arsenal suffer a shock exit from the Women's Champions League qualifiers as they are beaten on penalties by French side Paris FC.
articles.title: Arsenal knocked out of Women's Champions League

articles.description: Australia prove too polished for underdogs Georgia as they quickly see off any possibility of an opening-weekend World Cup upset at the Stade de France.
articles.title: Australia ease to opening win over Georgia

articles.description: Rory McIlroy breaks a club and finds water then rocks on the 16th hole at The K Club but surges into contention in the Irish Open.
articles.title: McIlroy in Irish Open contention after day of drama

articles.description: Follow live updates as Celtic face Valerenga in Women's Champions League qualifying after Glasgow City beat Gintra to progress.
articles.title: Women's Champions League: Valerenga 1-1 Celtic

articles.description: Watch highlights as ODI debutants Mahika Gaur and Lauren Filer take three wickets each as England beat Sri Lanka by seven wickets in the first one-day international at Chester-le-Street.
articles.title: Highlights: England thrash Sri Lanka in first ODI
